---
title: Resources Related to the mosaic Package
---

</br>
- [Intro Stats in R](http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/is5) (Horton and Chien) describes how to undertake analyses in De Veaux, Velleman, and Bock's *Intro Stats* (5th edition).
</br>
- [Introduction to the Practice of Statistics in R](http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/ips9) (NJ Horton, BS Baumer, and B Lin) describes how to undertake analyses in R that are introduced as examples in the first chapters of *Introduction to the Practice of Statistics* (9th edition), the excellent text by David Moore, George McCabe, and Bruce Craig
</br>
- [The Statistical Sleuth in R](http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/sleuth) (NJ Horton) describes how to undertake analyses in R for the examples in the first 13 chapters of the Third Edition of the *Statistical Sleuth: A Course in Methods of Data Analysis* (2013), by Fred Ramsey and Dan Schafer.
</br>
- A paper describing the mosaic package *Less Volume, More Creativity* approach is available [here](https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2017/RJ-2017-024)
</br>
- Additional mosaic-related resources and documentation are available [here](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/mosaic/vignettes/mosaic-resources.html)
</br>
- Additional mosaic package vignettes can be found at [here](http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/mosaic).
